meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being a condition that may or is likely to become cancer.
meanings.sent1: Regular check-ups are important to catch any precancerous cells early.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified a precancerous growth during the screening.
meanings.sent3: The precancerous cells were like tiny time bombs waiting to cause trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her precancerous condition was a dark cloud looming over her health.
meanings.sent5: The precancerous area glowed ominously on the medical scan.

meanings.definition: Having the potential to develop into cancer.
meanings.sent1: Avoiding sunburns can help prevent precancerous skin changes.
meanings.sent2: The biopsy revealed a precancerous lesion that needed treatment.
meanings.sent3: The precancerous spot on his arm was like a warning sign from his body.
meanings.sent4: Her precancerous condition whispered of danger lurking beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The precancerous cells danced on the edge of becoming a serious health issue.
